KataHira MainActivity Home Dashboard Guess Settings
View Katakana Characters Katakana Characters The word katakana means "fragmentary kana", as the katakana characters are derived from components or fragments of more complex kanji.
Katakana is most often used for transcription of words from foreign languages, loanwords, or onomatopoeia to represent sounds. View Hiragana Characters Hiragana Characters The word hiragana literally means "flowing" or "simple" kana ("simple" originally as contrasted with kanji).
Hiragana is used mainly for grammatical purposes. It is used on its own or in conjunction with kanji to form words. Diacritic Characters Basic Characters

Profile Name cannot be empty. Profile Name Add New Profile Add Profile name already exist. Profile added. Select your profile to record your progress. Rename Profile Set Profile renamed. Profile name must be unique. Select profile Yes No Profile deleted. Are you sure you want to delete '%s'? Select a Profile to Delete Select a Profile to Rename Select Add a profile first.
Playing… Select a Profile N/A Overview Recent Session Session History
Tutorial: How to Play? You can pick a syllabary whether Katakana or Hiragana to guess the characters. After selecting, press the Generate Character button to get a random character. You will be given three random choices in Romaji (Roman alphabet of Japanese characters) to the random Japanese character. Only one choice will contain the correct answer. Note: The correct answer will be highlighted in Lime green while the wrong choice will be highlighted in Red. A toast will show of what is the correct answer to the Japanese character. After selecting a choice, you can play the audio of how the character is pronounced by pressing the Speaker button. Results will show after all of your attempts have been used up. Pressing the Save & Close will record the session and display on the history. Note: You can try again by pressing the Reset button to start another guessing session. Note: If you pressed the Back button and exited while the guessing session has already started, the session will not be saved. Previous Next
Are you sure you want to exit? Your session will not be saved. Are you sure you want to exit? Are you sure you want to reset?
Add a profile Rename a profile Delete a profile Rank Prerequisites – Master: achieved 5 perfects each in Katakana and Hiragana
– Expert: achieved 3 to 4 perfects each in Katakana and Hiragana
– Intermediate: achieved 1 to 2 perfects each in Katakana and Hiragana
– Beginner: haven't yet to achieve any (0) perfects in Katakana or Hiragana Pronunciation Progress You can create and select profiles to record your guessing session of Katakana and/or Hiragana and also able to record your pronunciation progress of Japanese phrases. To create a profile, tap the user icon and give it a name. Selecting the created profile will make you able to guess the Katakana or Hiragana characters and initiating the Guessing menu by tapping the button. You can also rename a profile's name if you made a mistake or you just don't like the profile name, the choice is yours! You can also delete a profile if you don't want that profile to exist. Greetings: Phrases: 0/10 Current Profile: Progress: Grant Permission Granted. You can now use this feature. Please grant permission to use this feature. Mic icons will be available if you selected a profile in Dashboard menu. '%s' is now selected. Profiles: Create, Select, Edit, Delete Listening… Stop Listening ended. Correct Pronunciation. Incorrect Pronunciation, try again. Press BACK again to exit. Profile is required to record pronunciation progress. (Click anywhere to close.) Current progress of correct pronunciations. (Click anywhere to close.) You can try to pronounce the Japanese phrases by tapping the Mic icon. Note that you need to select a profile first in Dashboard menu. After tapping the Mic icon, it will ask permission to record audio (if launched for first time) for listening to the voice and evaluate it whether the pronunciation is correct or not. If the evaluation of the pronunciation was correct, a Check icon will show at the end of the Japanese phrase container indicating that the pronunciation was correct and done. You can also listen how the Japanese phrases sounds by tapping the Speaker icon. Pronunciation of Japanese Phrases
